body.name: MARTISAN Cordless Steam Iron, with Retractable Cord, Power Charging Base with Carry lock Easy Storage, 1500W, Ceramic Soleplate for clothes
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 6 hrs 54 mins
features: POWERFUL STEAM IRON: 1500W super hot steam iron heat-up in 30s, deliver a strong and consistent steam for quick remove wrinkles and creases, Quick power base recharges the iron as quick in seconds. Indicated light indicates when the iron is ready to use and reminds you when you need to recharge & reheat.

FREEDOM IRONING & EASY STORAGE: Wireless, retractable cord integrated in the power charging base. The lock to the charging base for easy carrying and immediately storage no need waiting for Soleplate Cool..

CERAMIC SOLEPLATE WITH ANTI-CALC, ANTI-DRIP: Durable and scratch resistant ceramic coating soleplate builded-in with anti-drip function under different steaming situation, but do not press the burst of steam more with low power, otherwise water will leak out. And the anti-calc function is meaning a special resin filter inside the water tank softens the water and prevents calcium buildup in the soleplate. The resin filter is permanent and doesn’t need to be re-placed.
SLEF-CLEANING: Self-cleaning removes deposits to maintain performance and increase the iron’s lifespan.

NOT A USED IRON & 8.5 FEET CORD: Every Steam Iron of MARTISAN passed the quality test 100% to ensure the function correctly and provide consumers with 100% satisfaction, so there will be a little bit of water (water is necessary for steam/burst steam/spray function test) left in the reservoir, will not affect the performance of the product.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: 2-in-1 CHARGING BASE Manage cord easily for neat and hassle-free storage. With just a little pulling, cord conveniently retracts into integrated storage compartment. Quick power base recharges the iron in seconds.

Features Spray Feature If clothes have been left to dry for too long creases can be a firm fixture. Giving fabric a quick spray is a good idea to soften it up and make ironing easier. A quick spritz is all it takes, and it means you don’t have to increase the heat to get a smooth result. Burst Steam This feature worked well for tough wrinkles and heavy fabrics, by pressing the burst steam button. Variable Temperature Control 5 range temperature dial makes it easy and precise when you iron a variety of fabrics such as wool, silk, linen, cotton etc.; always keep your clothes in perfect status.

Features Translucent Tank Our 270 ml water tank and, you will not be bothered to add water frequently. Carry/Storage Lock The iron attaches securely to its base with our carry-lock system. The cord is easily retracted within the base and held in place with a clip for tidy storage. Steam Level Before adding water, turn the steam selector to 0 to prevent leakage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great cordless iron at a reasonable price
reviews.reviewText: I really like this iron after it heats up it stayed heated when I was ironing I didn't have any problem with it cooling down in between the times I had set it on the base to reheat. I was surprised how big it was. The steam comes out great. you can even hold it up and have steam come out horizontally or vertically it really gets the job done not too many people use an iron anymore, but I iron a lot. and I was glad to be able to get a cordless iron at a reasonable price period

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Cannot Turn Off
reviews.reviewText: This iron, which had clearly been returned by at least one other customer, never cooled down unless the charging station was unplugged. There is no on/off control on the iron or the base, and the instructions contain no mention of this critical feature. Here’s a tip to the manufacturer: Add an on/off switch on the iron so users KNOW which state it is in. And if there is a way to turn it off, besides unplugging it, PUT THAT INFORMATION IN THE USER MANAL. I am returning it because I don’t want my home going up in flames.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best iron i ever had. Totally worth it. My sew buddy!
reviews.reviewText: This is so worth it. If you like sewing or iron in general, then this is an item for you. This is an item you will love. I definitely do. No more getting stuck on the court, heats up really fast and easy to use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars What you won't find in the Manual.
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Hi. I just bought this Iron. Today we're using it for the first time. What's easy is that it apparently comes charged. But you won't know that unless you turn the dial to set the temperature to heat it up. And it heats up very fast. Also, you won't know what temperature you're setting unless you look at the BOTTOM of the dial to set the temperature, not the top. There is difficult to see translucent vertical rectangle that I suppose is what represents the marker for where you're setting the temperature. (None of this is in the manual by the way. Nothing.)Now that that's out of the way. The charging experience. Firstly, one would think, you'd get a chargeable iron, charge it the first time, and a light would come on to tell you it's charged. Then you'd take it out of the base and iron something. Then you'd put it back in the base, and charge it until next time. What's great is that, the Ad claims it charges up in 30 seconds. So, if you run out of charge while ironing because you have so many clothes to iron, you can just stop, charge, and get back to ironing.The only problem is WHERE IS THE INDICATOR THAT IT IS CHARGED. Check the video. You can barely see it. My girlfriend, who is a Nurse (and very detail oriented - because she has to check little bottles for dosages before giving them to patients or she could make them sick). I'm an IT guy. So, I'm detail-oriented. (And a relentless problem-solver.) It's a Wi-Fi looking light that won't light up unless it's charging. And unfortunately, it goes out when it's not charged, and seems to go out when it's fully charged.What would be obvious is: It comes out of the box. The instructions say put it in the base, switch the lock (it has one on the base) to the locking position so it won't fall out, and plug the base into the wall with the iron locked into it. Leave it over night. This would give it a maximum charge. At this point the light should immediately come on and be flashing amber. Telling you it's busy charging leave it alone. Then, in the morning when you check it, the light should be green. Telling it's ready. If ironing and the charge is getting low, the light should come on like a car fuel indicator. It should pop on as amber (a low charge indicator like a low fuel indicator). Then you'd know you only have so long left to iron until you have to put it back in the base.Then the question becomes how fast will it re-charge if you still have more close to iron. I could go on but I've given enough free advise. If this company wants to grow and sell these, they need a new manual. And easier than that is to actually give this out to at least one person who is technical that can write in plain English (if you're selling to America then it's American English), and let them take it home and tell you all their problems. Then go back and let someone who used it write a draft of the manual. Then get a professional writer who writes manuals to write on that tells us all how to use this thing if it's a great as you say. Otherwise, all of your innovation may go completely missed.Go to your investors and tell them your customers said do just redo the manual. (And in the next version work on the lighting and probably relocate the charging indicator if that's not too troublesome, but honestly, you don't if you just have a good manual.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love this iron!
reviews.reviewText: This thing heats up so fast it is freaky. Love that about it as I'm usually late with getting it turned on. Now it's up and ready for cotton setting in no time. Very happy with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Only good thing is the cordless feature

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really good iron
reviews.reviewText: This product replaced a $70 iron that I bought from an infomercial whose name will stay nameless. (It’s gold). It works just as good if not better. The cradle holds the iron perfectly and fits in easy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars worked intermittently. stopped working completely in less than 2 years
reviews.reviewText: poor quality, lasted less than 2 years

reviews.reviewTitle: Good iron that does the job, bad user manual making users rely on review to get going
reviews.reviewText: It is easy to use and frankly does a good job as a cordless iron. It is best to recharge by putting it back to the station whenever possible during the ironing to keep it hot (as oppose to letting it stand somewhere else while you adjust the clothes). One thing that really bothers me at the beginning was no clear instructions on how to turn it on (you have to actually use the dial to select the right temperature before you put it on the station to get it charged; otherwise the light just doesn’t get “on”).Thankful there is a helpful review that does the work for this company otherwise I couldn’t imagine what would happen to all of those that doesn’t know why they design it this way.All in all it does a good job once I get used to it, and given the price I would say it is a good bargain. However the user manual should definitely be improved.
I like it’s cordless function. I dislike it because it’s quite heavy. This is not an iron for travelling.

Giving this a 1 star pending when my issue can be resolved. I’ve only used this iron once and its no longer charging. I can’t reach support. There’s no contact number on the martisan global website and the contact form does not lead anywhere. I’ve had to buy another iron since this is. Now useless to me. I suspect it’s a contact issue but I do not want to open it up so I don’t void the warranty. But what’s the use of a 1 year warranty if you can’t be reached. Facebook and Instagram pages on websites do not exist. Ridiculous.

nowhere do you mention you have to recharge the iron every 2 0r 3 minutes or it loses heat..the manual does not mention this anywhere.......and for this reason I'm not happyproduct works great but the internal charging system has a shot life span.John
